availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George W. Garnett (Harrison County, Kentucky, farmer )

body.p: Harrison County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Mary Townsend Garnett in Harrison County, Kentucky, in September 1844. Father of Mary A. Garnett. Stepfather of Harriett Townsend, George Townsend, William Townsend, David Townsend, and Amelia Townsend. Farmer in Harrison County in 1850. Employed George Townsend and Jefferson Crawford as farmers in Harrison County in 1850. Farmer in Harrison County in 1860. Employed David Johnson as a laborer in Harrison County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, District 1, p. 103B-104A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, p. 589.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Harrison County Marriages, Film #000216896.
